decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo, using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library and then using Dread Return to reanimate Thassa's Oracle for a win condition. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. It utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for combo pieces and disruption, and has some utility lands like Urza's Saga and Cavern of Souls to provide additional support. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to protect the combo from interaction by opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to fill your graveyard with cards, generate token creatures with Bridge from Below, and then cast a powerful combo finisher like Dread Return or Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck includes cards like Faithless Looting and Cabal Therapy to help set up your graveyard, while also running disruption spells like Poxwalkers and Otherworldly Gaze to protect your combo pieces. By carefully managing your graveyard and resources, you can overwhelm your opponent with a fast and efficient combo win.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation and Green Sun's Zenith to search for combo pieces, while also including disruption spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats. The deck aims to control the board and combo off in order to win the game efficiently. It also includes cards like Sylvan Library and Mox Diamond to provide card advantage and ramp, respectively.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and then using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring them back onto the battlefield for a strong reanimation strategy. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while controlling the game with counterspells and hand disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It also includes powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will to control the game and protect your creatures. The deck's strategy is to maintain tempo by disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Daze and Force of Negation, while also utilizing cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Overall, this deck aims to be aggressive and fast-paced, with the ability to adapt to various situations.

The main focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base through cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while quickly putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf. The deck aims to deny the opponent access to colored mana, allowing the player to attack freely with their creatures and finish the game with powerful spells like Sundering Eruption and Fury. By combining disruptive elements with a fast clock, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly casting powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Glaring Fleshraker and It That Heralds the End while utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith. With a mix of disruption and efficient creatures, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy and powerful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill out the opponent's entire library. The deck includes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Goblin Engineer to find and recur key combo pieces, while also including cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ensnaring Bridge for control and disruption. Additional cards like Pyroblast, Red Elemental Blast, and Lightning Bolt provide additional removal and interaction. The overall strategy is to set up the combo and control the game until the opponent is milled out.

This deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly bring powerful creatures onto the battlefield, bypassing traditional summoning costs. By combining reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large threats early in the game. With a mix of control elements like Force of Will and disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own powerful plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing creatures with disruptive abilities to control the game while applying pressure on the opponent. By combining Death & Taxes elements with an aggressive playstyle, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for extra value and resiliency, while cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Aether Vial provide additional utility and flexibility. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and utilizing the synergy between them to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on using lands as a control strategy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token, the deck aims to quickly close out the game. Cards like Wasteland and Crop Rotation help to disrupt the opponent's lands, while Life from the Loam and Exploration provide card advantage and ramp. The inclusion of utility lands like Bojuka Bog and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale further enhances the control aspect of the deck.
